page.title: 16FLAVOUR OF LIFE TODAY.
page.content: The population is smaller than it would have been 50 years ago.There are about 45 dwellings permanently occupied and 10 used as holiday accomodation.There is no public transport,but most have cars.There are 13 farms in the block where cattle and sheep are kept.One big estate lets its agricultural land to local farmers. Pheasants are reared.Only a small minority of residents are from past generations of locals.There is a Parish church,Public Hall,school,Post Office/shop,& 2 public houses.Doctors are in Longtown and Newcastleton. There are moblie shops and deliveries. Agriculture does not emplpy large numbers now due to efficient methods od farming.Public ntertainment is scarce but there are social gatherings in the Hall.Almost everyone knows everyone else and relations are good.
